pageContext.claim: “One-third of all the counties in America have only a single insurer selling coverage on an exchange, and next year it looks like nearly half of all counties in our country -- think of that -- all of the counties, one half will have only one insurer. And many will have none.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was using old information, as more insurance companies had signed up. The Kaiser Family Foundation says 21 percent enrollees had a choice of only one insurance company. No counties have none.
